title: Spring force - motion of weight on vertical spring

content.question: A weight is attached to a vertical spring that is fixed to a ceiling. The weight is held at rest at Point <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and then released. The weight falls downward, reaches its lowest position at Point <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>, and then begins to move upward. The weight then bounces up and down several times and then eventually comes to rest at Point <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>. Which of the following statements about the motion of the weight must be true whenever the weight is between points <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> and <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>?

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
